meanings.definition: An action that harms or damages someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Not fixing the leak in the roof was a real disservice to the house.
meanings.sent2: The disservice of spreading false rumors can hurt others deeply.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a disservice to wear muddy shoes on the clean carpet.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs is a disservice akin to playing with fire.
meanings.sent5: The disservice of skipping meals can lead to health problems.

meanings.definition: To harm or damage someone or something by failing to do something.
meanings.sent1: She felt she had done a disservice by not speaking up when she should have.
meanings.sent2: You can easily disservice your car by neglecting regular maintenance.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to water the plants would disservice them greatly.
meanings.sent4: Procrastinating on assignments can disservice your academic performance.
meanings.sent5: He didn't mean to disservice his friend by arriving late.
